page.title: 06EMPLOYMENT IN KIP VALLEY
page.content: The major source of employment in this area is the factory in Spango Valley run by{International Business Machines {.} They currently employ 2800 people and have not yet reached their maximum expansion. IBM moved to Spango Valley in 1954 where they rented a factory from the government. They were attracted to the area by good road communications and the nearby airports of Prestwick and Glasgow.Disadvantages of the site are lack of level ground to the NW and SE and the marshy ground of the valley floor. Their factory assembles visual display units. About 75% of the work force are local people .IBM runs a government sponsered training scheme for people of ages 18 and over. The work force is retrained by IBM. Other employment is provided by schools, shops, farms, hotels and Inverkip Marina.
